alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Campbell; Morgan; Roane; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 30 at 9:49AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Campbell, Morgan, Roane and Scott. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1044 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated more moderate rainfall occurring across parts of Scott and Morgan counties due to more showers and isolated thunderstorms moving from northwest to southeast. Minor flooding is expected to continue in the advisory area. Rainfall amounts of around 2 inches or more is estimated to have fallen in the past 2 hours across parts of the area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 inch or more is expected over the area during the next hour. This additional rain will result in more minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockwood, Oneida, Wartburg, Oliver Springs, Huntsville, Helenwood, Harriman, Winfield, Sunbright, Oakdale, Slick Rock, Elgin, Frozen Head State Park, Robbins, Rugby State Park, Petros, Rugby, Norma, Smokey Junction and Honey Creek State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
